questions.question: What is the study of energy and its transformation in chemical systems called?
What is the unit of pressure commonly used in chemistry?
What is the name given to the study of the rates of chemical reactions?
Which of the following is an example of an exothermic process?
What is the name given to the study of the interaction between light and matter?
Which of the following statements describes the behavior of an ideal gas?
options: The gas molecules occupy no volume and have no intermolecular forces
The gas molecules have a definite volume and strong intermolecular forces
The gas molecules have a definite volume and weak intermolecular forces
The gas molecules occupy no volume but have weak intermolecular forces
questions.correct_answer: The gas molecules occupy no volume and have no intermolecular forces

questions.question: What is the name given to the study of the movement of heat?
What is the name given to the maximum amount of solute that can dissolve in a solvent at a given temperature?
Which of the following is an example of a physical change?
Which of the following statements describes the behavior of an endothermic process?
options: Heat is absorbed from the surroundings
Heat is released to the surroundings
There is no change in heat
There is no change in temperature
questions.correct_answer: Heat is absorbed from the surroundings
